thing-type.label: FGD211 Universal Dimmer 500W
thing-type.description: Universal Dimmer 500W<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtRemotely controlled Dimmer is designed to operate with or without neutral lead. It may be used as a switch in systems without neutral lead.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtThe Dimmer enters the mode of inclusion after quick pressing three times the push-button connected to S1 terminal or push-button B located inside the housing.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtThe Dimmer enters the mode of exclusion after quick pressing three times the push-button connected to S1 terminal or push-button B located inside the housing.</p&gt

parameter.description: Checking the device status before sending a control frame from the key no. 2.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtInfo: Key no. 2 is not represented by any physical device expect of devices on association list. This functionality prevents of lack of reaction on pressing key no. 2 through polling devices from list one by one and checking thier actual states.</p&gt <p&gtIt is not possible to check the device status before sending a control frame from the key no. 2 if roller blind switch is chosen in parameter 14 (value 2)</p&gt <p&gtIf devices state is checked before sending asociation then parameter 19 should be set to value 0.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_41_1
parameter.label: 41: Scene activation functionality
parameter.description: Sending commands with command class scene activation<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe device offers the possibility of sending commands compatible with Command class scene activation. Information is sent to devices assigned to association group no. 3. Controllers such as Home Center 2 are able to interpret such commands and based on these commands they activate scenes, to which specific scene IDs have been assigned. The user may expand the functionality of the button connected to inputs S1 and S2 by distinguishing the actions of keys connected to those inputs. For example: double click would activate the scene "goodnight" and triple click would activate the scene "morning"</p&gt</p&gt
